decks.notes: The Boros Aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with removal like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck efficiently chips away at the opponent's life total. With cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah providing additional threats and Ranger-Captain of Eos and Thraben Charm offering disruption, the deck seeks to win the game before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base.

Utilizing Cascade triggers to cast Living End and return powerful creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield while disrupting opponents with counter spells and control elements. It aims to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and cycling cards to set up for a game-winning Living End. The deck also includes hard-to-counter threats like Curator of Mysteries and Waker of Waves to apply pressure on opponents. The combo potential combined with disruption tools makes it a versatile and competitive deck in the Modern format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays with cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ocelot Pride, supported by removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes utility cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Seasoned Pyromancer to maintain board presence and generate value. With a mix of creature aggression and spell removal, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on quickly milling cards from the opponent's library into their graveyard, utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Hedron Crab, and Fractured Sanity. It also includes disruption elements such as Surgical Extraction and Drown in the Loch to control the opponent's resources. The goal is to mill the opponent out of cards as quickly as possible while protecting the combo pieces. The deck can also utilize cards like Visions of Beyond and Tasha's Hideous Laughter to draw cards and further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting your opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation. It also utilizes the elemental tribal synergy with cards like Risen Reef and Flamebraider to generate value and card advantage. The inclusion of companions Kaheera, the Orphanguard adds an additional layer of synergy and consistency to the deck. By managing resources effectively and out-valuing your opponent, this deck aims to control the game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Allosaurus Rider and Neoform combo to quickly search for and play powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand. By utilizing cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence. The deck also incorporates other combo pieces such as Eldritch Evolution and Consign to Memory to further enhance its versatility and ability to adapt to different situations. Overall, the deck's key strategy revolves around efficiently assembling powerful creatures and combo pieces to dominate the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana and play Primeval Titan quickly. It also includes combo pieces like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift to search for specific cards and achieve a quick victory. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly and assemble the necessary pieces for a powerful combo finish to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, it includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Tolaria West for additional versatility and flexibility in executing its strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and artifacts, utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly. It aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker, while also utilizing Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing strategies. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon is a key threat and board wipe, while also providing card advantage. The deck has a strong late-game with big Eldrazi finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through resource denial and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using Primal Prayers and Malevolent Rumble to generate mana and control the board while setting up a combo win condition with Laboratory Maniac. The deck uses cards like Dour Port-Mage and Formidable Speaker to disrupt the opponent's strategy while digging for combo pieces with Shardless Agent. Ice-Fang Coatl and Utopia Sprawl provide additional value and card advantage. The deck also utilizes Force of Negation for protection and control. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and ultimately win the game through a well-timed combo.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation. The deck also includes a variety of control elements like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats on the board. A key aspect of this deck is its ability to generate significant value from creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Emperor of Bones, while also maintaining a strong mana base through fetch lands and various dual lands.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to apply pressure early on with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while also having ways to deal direct damage with spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also includes support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to boost the strength of its creatures and protect them. The goal is to maintain a fast pace and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while reducing the cost of spells with Ruby Medallion. The goal is to cast spells that deal damage to the opponent, such as Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible, while also utilizing cards like Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard. Wrenn's Resolve helps to protect key pieces of the combo, while cards like Reckless Impulse provide card advantage. The deck also includes some land manipulation with Valakut Awakening and Gemstone Caverns.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts with low casting costs to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. It includes cards that can disrupt the opponent's strategy, protect key pieces, and generate card advantage. The goal is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent while also having ways to interact with their game plan. The deck aims to win the game quickly by leveraging its synergy and efficiency to outpace the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and sacrificing them for various effects to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By deploying cheap artifacts and using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Arcbound Ravager, the deck can quickly build a threatening board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key artifacts, and Mox Opal helps accelerate the deck's mana production. The deck aims to win the game through aggressive plays and efficient use of artifacts.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to quickly establish a board presence. It also includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck includes some control elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to disrupt opponent strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures, burn spells, and control elements, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of brute force and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts, utilizing Urza's Saga to tutor for key pieces like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear. The deck seeks to establish a strong presence on the board early on, with the ability to quickly close out games thanks to the synergy between artifacts and creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Ornithopter. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Dismember and Metallic Rebuke adds flexibility and control elements to the deck's aggressive game plan.
